question: A uniform magnetic field of strength B = 2 mT exists vertically downwards. These magnetic field lines pass through a closed surface as shown in the figure. The closed surface consists of a hemisphere S₁, a right circular cone S₂ and a circular surface S₃. The magnetic flux through S₁ and S₂ are respectively
images/e5f6a1b2-c3d4-4e5f-2a3b-890123456790.png
explanation: B is downwards. S1 is the top hemisphere (flux enters, so negative). S2 is the bottom cone (flux leaves, so positive).
Magnitude = B × Area = 2 mT × πR² = 2×10⁻³ × π(10/√π)² × 10⁻⁴ = 20 μWb.
